oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Outdoor movie set for "Wild River"
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph shows large movie lights and a large fan in front the front yard of a Dutch-style house. The house features include hip roof, two chimneys, three window dormers, and a covered front porch.

The movie "Wild River" (1960) brought attention to the thousands of Tennesseans who had been forced to abandon their homes and land to make way for the Tennessee Valley Authority. The house was used as the Garth family homestead in the movie directed by Elia Kazan. The main stars were Montgomery Clift and Lee Remick.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Motion pictures; Dwellings; Studio props
